oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A STUDY ON PHENOMENA OF FLOW AND THERMAL DIFFUSION CAUSED BY OUTFALL OF COOLING WATEP.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Wada, Akira
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: thermal diffusion
outfall of cooling water
flow of cooling water
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This report concerns with the investigation of recirculation of cooling water discharged from outlet of thermal (or atomic) power stations sited on a hay under the tidal and wind effects. In this study, the author describes the effect of some dominant factors on the recirculation and shows a method to estimate the temperature distribution and velocity field in the bay by numerical experiment. Especially, numerical experiments m the vertical section are examined by taking account of the interaction between the flow and thermal diffusion.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 10 (1966): Proceedings of 10th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Tokyo, Japan, 1966.; 77
